summary.title: Bank Threat Model
summary.description:
System Overview
The banking system consists of  infrastructure and digital assets that facilitate financial transactions, customer data storage, and secure communication between banking entities. The system includes online banking services, ATMs, internal employee platforms, and customer account management.

2. Core Components

  Customer Data

   Stores personal and financial information of customers.
   Used for identity verification, transactions, and account management.

 Threats:
     Data Breach: Unauthorized access to sensitive data.
    Phishing Attack: Attackers trick users into providing credentials.
 
 Banking Infrastructure

   Core system responsible for processing transactions, fund transfers, and account management.
  Connected to various banking applications, ATMs, and third-party services.
    Threats:
    Ransomware Attack: Malware encrypts banking data and demands ransom.
     Insider Threat: Malicious or compromised employees leak sensitive data.

Automated Teller Machines (ATMs) deployed in various locations.
Handles cash withdrawals, deposits, and card transactions.
Threats:
Physical Tampering: Skimmers installed to steal customer card data.
DDoS Attack: Attackers disrupt network communication to ATMs.
Internal Employee Systems

4. Security Considerations
Data Encryption: Encrypt sensitive customer data in transit and at rest.
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA): Prevent unauthorized access to accounts.
DDoS Mitigation: Implement rate limiting and firewalls.
Insider Threat Detection: Monitor employee activity for suspicious behavior.
